text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Vietnamese press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- The goverment has called for bids for the construction of a chain of ten major fishing ports stretching along Vietnam's coastline.
-- Visiting U.S. congressmen have said they want to see a trade agreement signed early.
-- Vietnam and Laos have expressed their wish that Cambodia will join ASEAN soon.
-- Foreign vessels failing to enter the northern ports of Hai Phong, Cai Lan, Cam Pha and Hon Gai have been allowed to anchor, load and unload goods in an offshore port in Ha Long Bay.
-- The Communist Party admitted 47,131 new members throughout the country in the first six months of this year.
-- The central highland province of Gia Lai plans to establish five industrial zones.
-- At least 80 people have been killed by dengue fever in Mekong Delta provinces so far this year.
-- 83,000 branches of the peasant association have been set up in 44 provinces and city throughout the country.
-- The Ministry of Planning and Investment has submitted a $138 million project to build a 500 Kilovolt power transmission line in the central highlands.
-- Two border soldiers who shot dead seven people and injured four others last month have committed suicide.
